perturbation.original_text: Each of the Participants will contribute to the capital of the Joint Venture, in cash or property in agreed upon value. All Participants will contribute their respective Contributions as agreed.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the Participants may contribute to the capital of the Joint Venture, in cash or property. Specific contributions will be determined at a later date.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates contributions, while the modified text makes it optional and defers the specifics, creating uncertainty about the commitment of capital to the joint venture. This contradicts the implicit understanding that each member will contribute to the venture.

perturbation.original_text: Subject to any other provisions of this Agreement, the net profits and losses of the Joint Venture, for both accounting and tax purposes, will accrue to and be borne by the Participants in proportion to the Participants' Capital Contributions inclusive of any Additional Capital Contributions (the "Profit and Loss Distribution").
perturbation.changed_text: Subject to any other provisions of this Agreement, the net profits and losses of the Joint Venture will be distributed as the Participants see fit.
perturbation.explanation: By removing that profits and losses be in proportion to Capital Contributions, the contract creates an internal contradiction. Now there is no definition for how the profits and losses are to be distributed. This creates ambiguity regarding how profits and losses will be shared.

perturbation.original_text: In the event of the dissolution of the Joint Venture, each Participant will share in any remaining assets or liabilities of the Joint Venture in proportion to the Participants' Capital Contributions inclusive of any Additional Capital Contributions (the "Dissolution Distribution").
perturbation.changed_text: In the event of the dissolution of the Joint Venture, each Participant will share in any remaining assets or liabilities of the Joint Venture according to the discretion of the governing body.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the reference to the 'Dissolution Distribution' (which is based on Capital Contributions) and replacing it with the ambiguous phrase 'discretion of the governing body' creates an internal contradiction. Because there are no terms set, the value of any capital contributions are not protected.
